Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1opoCzm"><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/06b7fb078f9109e8fcb9aa9c745d95bc/tumblr_inline_n9ao7t6hc51rr2wit.png"/><br/></a></p>

<p>Ever wonder what happens when we generate builds for a new update? <strong>HarvesteR</strong> explains all that goes into the build pipeline in this <a href="http://bit.ly/1opoCzm"><strong>ARTICLE</strong></a>.</p>
I expected the process to be a bit more complicated than that... but hey, it works (i assume) so I'm not complaining

I expected the process to be a bit more complicated than that... but hey, it works (i assume) so I'm not complaining

It makes me a little nervous about playing on linux, but hey, it's been working so far...
I still don't understand why you don't get multiple servers and cluster them with RRDNS - whenever you release a major update the server either becomes unreachable, or speeds get extremely slow.

Money.

Servers are expensive.

Internet pipes to servers are also expensive.
Indeed. Best move ever was putting KSP up on Steam so their massive servers could pick up most of the load!
